column4: the lsb_release -a gives these results:   No LSB modules are available.    Distributor ID: Ubuntu     Description:    Ubuntu 9.10    Release:        9.10    Codename:       karmic
This confuses me, because I upgraded this AM from jaunty, changed the sources to the EOL sources for karmic, and upgraded again...and it spent an hour or two churning through all that.
Can I do an upgrade by downloading the iso?
from karmic?
Apparently I'm still in Karmic...which is confusing me because I thought the last two hours were an upgrade from Karmic...

My sources.list, no doubt, needs an upgrade from the Karmic EOL repositories anyway...but that whole thing this morning about setting the prompt in etc/update-manager/release-upgrades to LTS I thought was intended to address this...
check the link I just gave you
Okay, thanks, I'm looking at it now...do I need to adjust my sources.list?
Okay...there's already a snag: I don't understand Step 1: "Start System/Administration/Software Sources"  I'm not running kde/gnome
then do the server one
Okay, thanks.  Technically I'm running kubuntu, but with WindowMaker...
the steps for server are right there, need help with those?
No, I think I have it, as long as the Prompt thing is supposed to be normal...thanks!
how much do you have
what does the installer say it needs
at some point you'll need to expand that nonetheless
up to you when that is.
yes, dont do it
Thanks.  I thought it seemed like a bad idea.  I'll wait until after the upgrade...which looks like it'll take 8 hours just to download (apparently not using all my bandwidth for the download)
long term support 3 years desktop, 5 years server
no, you need to go step by step, for the upgrades, unless it is LTS to LTS which can jump over those
pooltable please continue this chat in the #ubuntu-offtopic channel, thanks.
